Contradict fact: The claim that a US military helicopter was shot down over the Iraqi-Syrian border in 2020 is contradicted by the evidence provided, which shows that the photo used in the claim was taken in 2003 and there were no casualties in the Iranian missile strikes in 2020.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or credible sources provided to verify the occurrence of the alleged helicopter being shot down.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photo used in the misleading post is related to an incident in 2020, while it is actually from 2003. This assumption is problematic and misleads the audience.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the misleading post used an old photo to falsely claim that a US military helicopter was shot down in 2020, when in fact it was not.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that a US military helicopter was shot down, when there is no evidence to support this claim.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by using a misleading photo and providing inaccurate information about an incident that did not occur in 2020.
